title: Code Scalpel Response Configuration Schema
description: Configure MCP tool response output verbosity for token efficiency. Controls which metadata/tool data fields are included in responses - independent of tier.

version.description: Code Scalpel version this config is for

global.description: Global settings applied to all tools unless overridden

profile.description: Default output profile. minimal=~50-100 tokens, standard=~100-500, verbose=~500-2000, debug=unlimited

profiles.description: Named output profiles. 'profile' in global or tool_overrides refers to these names.

common_exclusions.description: Fields to exclude from all tool responses at this profile level

tool_overrides.description: Per-tool configuration. Keys are tool names (e.g., analyze_code, security_scan).

exclude_fields.description: Fields to always exclude from this tool's response

include_only.description: Whitelist mode: only include these fields

include_on_error.description: Extra fields included only when the tool returns an error

exclude_when_tier.description: Tier-conditional exclusions. Keys are tier names (community, pro, enterprise); values are arrays of field names to exclude at that tier. Useful for suppressing heavy metadata on lower tiers.
